page.title: International incidents during the 2006 Lebanon War

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{cleanup|date=June 2009}} {{update|date=June 2009}} }} [[Image:Destroyed UN base in Lebanon.jpg|thumb|right|Aftermath of IDF airstrike on UN patrol base [[Khiam]], Lebanon, 2006]] [[Image:Entrance to destroyed UN base.jpg|thumb|The entrance to the UN base where four UN peacekeepers were killed during the 2006 Lebanon conflict]] During the [[2006 Lebanon War]], a number of '''international incidents''' occurred in Lebanon, largely involving [[United Nations]] personnel in [[Lebanon]], who have come under a number of attacks. On 25 July 2006, four unarmed [[United Nations Truce Supervision Organization]] (UNTSO) peacekeepers were killed during an Israeli air strike on a UN observation post in southern Lebanon. Israel motivated the attack as wrong identification of target as a militant enemy post.
==UN operations in Lebanon==
The [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]], or UNIFIL, was created by the [[United Nations]], by [[UN Security Council|Security Council]] [[UN Security Council Resolution|Resolution]] [[UN Security Council Resolution 425|425]] and [[UN Security Council Resolution 426|426]] on 19 March 1978. UNIFIL objective was to confirm [[Israel]]i withdrawal from [[Lebanon]], to restore international peace and security, and to help the Lebanese Government restore effective authority in the area.<ref name="UNSup5">{{cite web |url=http://legal.un.org/repertory/art98/english/rep_supp5_vol5-art98_e.pdf#pagemode=none |title=Extracts relating to Article 98 of the Charter of the United Nations: Supplement No 5 (1970 - 1978) |accessdate=2006-08-06 |format=PDF |work=Repertory of Practice of United Nations Organs |publisher=[[United Nations]] |pages=§275–279 |language= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019222951/http://legal.un.org/repertory/art98/english/rep_supp5_vol5-art98_e.pdf |archivedate=2013-10-19 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> The first UNIFIL troops to arrive in the area on 23 March 1978 were reassigned from other UN [[peacekeeping]] operations in the area (namely [[United Nations Emergency Force|UNEF]] and [[UNDOF]]).<ref name = "UNSup5" />
During the [[1982 Lebanon War]], U.N. positions were overrun, primarily by the [[South Lebanon Army]] forces under Major [[Saad Haddad]]. These were the indigenous Lebanese forces supported by the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]].<ref name="UNsup6">{{cite web |url=http://legal.un.org/repertory/art98/english/rep_supp6_vol6-art98_e.pdf |title=Extracts relating to Article 98 of the Charter of the United Nations: Supplement No 6 (1979 - 1984) |accessdate=2006-08-06 |format=PDF |work=Repertory of Practice of United Nations Organs |publisher=[[United Nations]] |pages=§185–§199 |language= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019222939/http://legal.un.org/repertory/art98/english/rep_supp6_vol6-art98_e.pdf |archivedate=2013-10-19 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> During the occupation, UNIFIL's function was mainly to provide humanitarian aid.<ref name = "UNsup6" /> In 1999, Israel undertook a full withdrawal, which concluded in 2000 and enabled UNIFIL to resume its military tasks. The [[United Nations Security Council|UN Security Council]] has extended UNIFIL's mandate until August 31, 2006.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher = [[United Nations Security Council]] |date = July 31, 2006 |url = http://daccessdds.un.org/doc/UNDOC/GEN/N06/450/28/PDF/N0645028.pdf?OpenElement |format = PDF |title = Resolution 1697 (2006) |accessdate = 2006-08-06 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060821200207/http://daccessdds.un.org/doc/UNDOC/GEN/N06/450/28/PDF/N0645028.pdf?OpenElement |archivedate = 21 August 2006 |deadurl = yes |df = }} </ref>
UNIFIL's function was mainly the provision of food and aid to locals in Southern Lebanon. In 1999, Israel undertook a full withdrawal, which concluded in 2000 and enabled UNIFIL to resume its military tasks. At Lebanon' request, in January 2006 the UN extended UNIFIL's mandate to expire 31 July 2006.
==25 July attack on UN observation post == <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:OP Khiam from East.jpg|thumb|220px|The UN patrol base Khiam prior to the IDF air strike]] -->
===Attack=== On 25 July 2006 four unarmed [[United Nations Truce Supervision Organization]] (UNTSO) peacekeepers from Austria, China, Finland and Canada were killed in an Israeli air strike at a UN observation post in southern Lebanon. According to the UN, the four had taken shelter in a bunker under the post, which was a three story building inside a patrol base in [[Khiyam]].<ref name="unifilJuly26">{{cite press release |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] |date=July 26, 2006 |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr010.pdf |format=PDF |title=PRESS RELEASE |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060803093635/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr010.pdf |archivedate=3 August 2006 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> The area had been struck by artillery and aerial bombardment over a period of 6 hours. According to the IDF, Hezbollah artillery had been firing at Israeli positions from the area. According to a UN official who had seen the preliminary report, the post called an Israeli liaison officer ten times to call off the bombardment and an Israeli official promised to halt the bombing each time.<ref name = "Haaretz 727">{{cite web | url = http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/743051.html | title = U.S. blocks UN statement condemning Israel for strike on observer's post | accessdate = 2006-08-06 | last = Azoulay | first = Yuval |author2=Amos Harel |author3=Yoav Stern |author4=Shmuel Rosner |author5=News Agencies | date = July 27, 2006 | work = | publisher = [[Haaretz]] | pages = | language = | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060816165547/http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/743051.html| archivedate= 16 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref>
A UNIFIL rescue team of Indian soldiers was immediately dispatched to the scene. They recovered the bodies of three observers from the rubble while there was still active hostilities.<ref name="Reuters 999">{{cite web |url=http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/N25237440.htm |title=Annan asks Israel to probe 'targeting' of UN post |accessdate=2006-08-07 |date=July 26, 2006 |work= |publisher=[[Reuters]] |pages= |language= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060726023704/http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/N25237440.htm |archivedate=2006-07-26 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> [[Danny Ayalon]], Israel's ambassador to the United States, said that "UNIFIL obviously got caught in the middle" of a gunfight between Hezbollah guerillas and Israeli troops."We do not have yet confirmation what caused these deaths. It could be (Israel Defense Forces). It could be Hezbollah," he said.<ref name=CNN-07-25>{{cite news|title=U.N.: Israeli airstrike hits U.N. observer post|date=2006-07-25|publisher=[[CNN]]|url=http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/25/mideast.main/index.html}}</ref>
===Victims=== By 8 August 2006, the bodies of observers were retrieved and identified. The four victims of the attack, from UNTSO Team Sierra, were: * Sierra Team Leader: Major '''Hans-Peter Lang''', 44, from [[Güssing]],<ref>http://bglv1.orf.at/stories/125634</ref> [[Austria]].<ref>{{cite web| date=2006-07-28|title = Österreicher weiterhin nicht identifiziert|url=http://www.diepresse.com/Artikel.aspx?channel=p&ressort=a&id=574703}}</ref> He was survived by an 11-year-old son and his 70-year-old mother. * Sierra Deputy Team Leader: Lieutenant Senior Grade '''Jarno Mäkinen''', 29, from [[Kaarina]], [[Finland]]. Lt Mäkinen was a former unit commander in the [[Uusimaa Brigade]]. He was transferred to the UNTSO in November 2005.<ref>{{cite web |date=2006-07-27|url=http://newsroom.finland.fi/stt/showarticle.asp?intNWSAID=13268&group=General|title=Finnish military releases name of officer feared dead in Israel air strike|publisher=Finnish News Agency STT}}</ref> * Major (Posthumously promoted Lieutenant Colonel) '''Du Zhaoyu''' (杜照宇), 34, from [[Jinan]], [[China]]. He had served as secretary to the military attache in the Chinese Embassy in India. He left his wife and a one-year-old son.<ref>{{cite web |date=2006-07-27|url=http://www.shanghaidaily.com/art/2006/07/27/287377/Israel_says_it_regrets_UN_observer_deaths.htm|title=Israel says it regrets UN observer deaths|publisher=Shanghai Daily}}</ref> *Major '''Paeta Derek Hess-von Kruedener''', from [[Kingston, Ontario|Kingston]], [[Canada]]. A member of the [[Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry]], he had previously served in Cyprus, Bosnia and Congo before serving in UNTSO from October 2005.<ref>{{cite web | date = 2006-07-27 | title = Tough guy jumper killed in UN bombing | url = http://www.canada.com/nationalpost/news/story.html?id=825b8207-915b-4176-821f-9658b06d14a0&k=90130&p=1 | publisher = National Post | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070929111853/http://www.canada.com/nationalpost/news/story.html?id=825b8207-915b-4176-821f-9658b06d14a0&k=90130&p=1 | archivedate = 2007-09-29 | df = }}</ref>
===Responses=== [[Secretary-General of the United Nations|Secretary-General]] [[Kofi Annan]] initially stated that he was "…shocked and deeply distressed by the apparently deliberate targeting by Israeli Defence Forces."<ref name ="BBC726">{{cite web | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5215366.stm | title = Israeli bomb kills UN observers | accessdate = 2006-08-06 | date = July 26, 2006 | work = | publisher = BBC | pages = | language = | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060813190324/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/5215366.stm| archivedate= 13 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref> "This coordinated artillery and aerial attack on a long-established and clearly marked U.N. post at Khiyam occurred despite personal assurances given to me by Prime Minister Ehud Olmert that U.N. positions would be spared Israeli fire," he said in a statement. "Furthermore, General [[Alain Pellegrini]], the U.N. force commander in south Lebanon, had been in repeated contact with Israeli officers throughout the day, stressing the need to protect that particular U.N. position from attack."<ref>"[http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/meast/07/26/mideast.observers/index.html U.N.: Observers made many calls before strike]," ''[[CNN]]'', July 26, 2006.</ref>
Ayalon, Israeli ambassador to the United States called Annan's statement "outrageous," while Israel's U.N. ambassador, [[Dan Gillerman]], said he, too, was "deeply distressed" that Annan alleged that the strike was deliberate. "I am surprised at these premature and erroneous assertions made by the secretary-general, who while demanding an investigation, has already issued its conclusions," Gillerman said in a statement.<ref name=CNN-07-25/> However, as at the time Annan had only circumstantial evidence for the bombing being deliberate, many pundits described Annan’s statement as indicative of the UN's anti-Israel bias.<ref name="nydailynews.com">{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/ideas_opinions/story/438283p-369293c.html |title=Kofi Annan shows his stripes |work=Editorial page |publisher=[[New York Daily News]] |date=July 27, 2006 |accessdate=2006-07-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060922110515/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/ideas_opinions/story/438283p-369293c.html |archivedate=September 22, 2006 |df= }} </ref><ref name="jpost.com">{{cite news |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1153292005902&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull |title=Annan's libel |work=Editorial |publisher=[[Jerusalem Post]] |date=July 26, 2006 |accessdate=2006-08-01 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} </ref><ref name = "MacK">{{cite news |author = Mackenzie, Lewis |title = Kofi Annan's hasty rush to judgment |work=[[The Globe and Mail]] |pages = |page = A15 |date = July 27, 2006 |language = |authorlink = Lewis MacKenzie }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} '''Note:''' Globeandmail.com version here [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/Page/document/v4/sub/MarketingPage?user_URL=https://www.theglobeandmail.com%2Fservlet%2Fstory%2FLAC.20060727.COMACK27%2FTPStory%2F%3Fquery%3DKofi%2BAnnan%2592s%2Bhasty%2Brush%2Bto%2Bjudgment%2B&ord=1154468653759&brand=theglobeandmail&force_login=true], but subscription required. </ref><ref name=Known_better>{{cite news |first = Lorne |last = Gunter |url = http://www.canada.com/edmontonjournal/columnists/story.html?id=9f08bcd9-0c43-4023-992a-420101eba0bb |title = Annan should have known better: Israel's record of care suggests bombing of UN peacekeeping post was accidental |work = Opinion |publisher = [[The Edmonton Journal]] |page = A16 |date = July 28, 2006 |accessdate = 2006-08-01 |language = |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060928075055/http://www.canada.com/edmontonjournal/columnists/story.html?id=9f08bcd9-0c43-4023-992a-420101eba0bb |archivedate = September 28, 2006 |df = }} '''Note:''' The Edmonton Journal version here {{cite web |url = http://www.canada.com/edmontonjournal/news/opinion/story.html?id%3D9f08bcd9-0c43-4023-992a-420101eba0bb |title = Archived copy |accessdate = 2006-08-06 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121102184936/http://www.canada.com/edmontonjournal/news/opinion/story.html?id=9f08bcd9-0c43-4023-992a-420101eba0bb |archivedate = 2012-11-02 |df = }}, but subscription required. </ref><ref name="http">{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/ideas_opinions/story/438575p-369506c.html |title=Mr. Annan, meet the truth |work=Editorial page |publisher=[[New York Daily News]] |date=July 28, 2006 |accessdate=2006-08-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061001071956/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/ideas_opinions/story/438575p-369506c.html |archivedate=October 1, 2006 |df= }}</ref><ref name="MelKoifime">{{cite web | url = http://www.aish.com/societyWork/society/Mel3_Kofi_and_Me.asp | title= Mel, Kofi, and me | accessdate = 2006-08-06 | last = Shafran | first = Avi | date = August 6, 2006 | work = Society Today | publisher = [[Aish HaTorah]] | pages = | language = | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060812133143/http://www.aish.com/societyWork/society/Mel3_Kofi_and_Me.asp| archivedate= 12 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref>
An Israeli senior commander stated that Hezbollah forces fired rockets from as little as 30-40m from UNIFIL bases, seeking to avoid Israeli counter-fire, and had sought refuge in UNIFIL bases on occasion. UNIFIL maintained that Hezbollah fighters were not allowed into any of its bases. However, they reported more than 20 instances of rockets being fired from less than 500m from their positions, as well as a number of cases of small arms and mortar fire from within 100m. Additionally, UNIFIL reported several instances of their positions and vehicles being hit by Hezbollah mortars, small arms fire, or rockets.<ref>[https://www.amnesty.org/en/documents/mde02/033/2006/en/ Israel/Lebanon: Out of all proportion - civilians bear the brunt of the war | Amnesty International<!-- Bot generated title -->] </ref>
On 26 July 2006, Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]] phoned Kofi Annan and expressed his deep regret over the death of the four UN observers. He promised that Israel would thoroughly investigate the incident and would share the findings with Annan, but said that he was taken aback by secretary general’s statement saying that the Israeli attack on the UN post was “apparently deliberate”.<ref name = "ynet">{{cite web|date=2006-07-27|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3281510,00.html|title=PM apologizes for UN observers' death, criticizes Annan|publisher=ynetnews.com}}</ref> The Israeli ambassador to the UN, [[Dan Gillerman]], ruled out major U.N. involvement in any potential international force in Lebanon, saying that more professional and better-trained troops were needed for such a volatile situation.<ref>{{cite web | url = https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20060728/ap_on_re_mi_ea/un_israel_mideast_1;_ylt=AtrEQpM0_uAYOmYlrlVViegUvioA;_ylu=X3oDMTBiMW04NW9mBHNlYwMlJVRPUCUl | title = Israel nixes major U.N. role in Lebanon | accessdate = 2006-08-06 | last = Wadhams | first = Nick | date = July 27, 2006 | work = | publisher = [[The Associated Press]], as quoted in [[Yahoo News]] | pages = | language = }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} </ref>
At a press conference the next day, Annan seemed to soften his stance and clarified that "[t]he statement said 'apparently deliberate targeting,'" stressing that the word "apparent is important in this." He added that he spoke to Olmert and accepted his "deep sorrow" for the incident, which he said Olmert "definitely believes" was a mistake that would be investigated.<ref name = "Jerusalem Post">{{cite web | url = http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull&cid=1153291996858 | title = UN: Precision missiles hit UNTSO post | accessdate = 2007-04-11 | last = Katz | first = Yaakov |author2=Herb Keinon |author3=Amir Mizroch | date = July 26, 2006 | work = | publisher = [[Jerusalem post]] | pages = | language = }}{{dead link|date=January 2017|bot=medic}} </ref>
Canada’s Prime Minister, [[Stephen Harper]], said he does not believe Israel targeted the post, and pointed to the fact that Israel has been “co-operating with us in our evacuation efforts, in our efforts to move Canadian citizens out of Lebanon, and also trying to keep our own troops that are on the ground involved in the evacuation out of harm's way.”<ref name = "CBC726">{{cite web | url = http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2006/07/25/un-lebanon.html | title = Harper doubts UN post deliberately targeted | accessdate = 2006-08-06 | date = July 26, 2006 | work = | publisher = [[CBC News]] | pages = | language = }} </ref> He also has exclaimed his concern with the UN in that the post “remained manned during what is now, more or less, a war.”<ref name = "CBC726" />
However, Ireland’s Foreign Minister Dermot Ahern and its Defence Minister [[Willie O'Dea]] were angered because Irish peace keeping troops had been on duty in the observation post 24 hours before the strike. They also said that a senior Irish soldier working for the UN forces was in contact with the Israeli Defence Force's UNIFIL liaison office six times to warn them that their bombardment was endangering the lives of UN staff. Both Ministers called in the Israeli Ambassador to Ireland to express their anger and dissatisfaction.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.breakingnews.ie/ireland/irish-un-workers-warned-israelis-of-airstrike-six-times-269523.html | title = Irish UN workers warned Israelis of airstrike six times | accessdate = 2014-07-21 | last = | first = | date = July 26, 2006 | work = | publisher = [[breakingnews.ie]] | pages = | language = | archvedate = }} </ref>
Ireland has filed an official protest with Israel. China has also strongly condemned the action and demanded that Israel apologize for the attack. Austria's foreign minister, Ursula Plassnik, told her Israeli counterpart by telephone that the bombing was unacceptable and urged Israel to stop its attack on the area.<ref name = "CBC726" />
In an interview with [[Reuters]], Israeli Foreign Ministry spokesman [[Mark Regev]] said that “Israel sincerely regrets the tragic death of the UN personnel in south Lebanon. We do not target UN personnel and, since the beginning of this conflict, we have made a consistent effort to ensure the safety of all members of (the UN peacekeeping force). This tragic event will be thoroughly investigated.”<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/L25760607.htm |title=Israel expresses regret over U.N. deaths |accessdate=2006-08-06 |date=July 26, 2006 |work= |publisher=[[Reuters]] |pages= |language= |df= }}{{dead link|date=January 2017|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} </ref>
On 27 July, the [[United Nations Security Council]] issued a statement calling on the Israeli government to conduct a comprehensive inquiry into the incident and stressed that “Israel and all concerned parties” must comply with their obligations under [[international humanitarian law]] on the protection of UN personnel.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher= [[United Nations Security Council]] |date= July 27, 2006 |url= https://www.un.org/News/Press/docs//2006/sc8788.doc.htm |title= SECURITY COUNCIL ‘DEEPLY SHOCKED AND DISTRESSED’ BY ISRAELI FIRING ON UNITED NATIONS OBSERVER POST IN LEBANON, WHICH KILLED FOUR PEACEKEEPERS |accessdate= 2006-08-06 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060807191850/http://www.un.org/News/Press/docs/2006/sc8788.doc.htm| archivedate= 7 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref>
===Investigation into the bombing=== Israel has launched an investigation into the bombing and has concluded that the incident was an error.{{Citation needed|date=June 2007}} The report says flawed military maps meant the post was wrongly targeted.{{Citation needed|date=June 2007}} Israel's foreign ministry spokesman, Mark Regev, told that the report concludes the attack was an error.{{Citation needed|date=June 2007}} Israeli aircraft attacked the post in the belief it was a Hezbollah position.{{Citation needed|date=June 2007}}
In 2008, the [[Canadian Forces]] released a report on the inquiry of the attack. The report blamed the Israeli Defence Forces for the incident. It also stated that both the Israeli military and the UN refused to provide requested documents for the investigation.<ref>{{cite news|title=UN officer reported Israeli war crimes before deadly bombing: widow|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/story/2008/02/06/ot-von-kruedener-080206.html|date=2008-02-26|publisher=[[CBC News]]}}</ref>
====July 18 email message==== In an email dated 18 July received by [[CTV Television Network|CTV]] and published 24 July, the deceased Canadian peacekeeper Major Paeta Hess-von Kruedener, stated: “What I can tell you is this: we have on a daily basis had numerous occasions where our position has come under direct or indirect fire from both artillery and aerial bombing. The closest artillery has landed within 2 meters of our position and the closest 1000 lb aerial bomb has landed 100 meters from our patrol base. This has not been deliberate targeting, but has rather been due to tactical necessity.”<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060718/mideast_lebanon_UN_060716/20060718/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060813100141/http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060718/mideast_lebanon_UN_060716/20060718/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=August 13, 2006 |title=A Canadian soldier's report from South Lebanon |accessdate=2006-08-07 |date=July 26, 2006 |work= |publisher=[[CTV television network]] |pages= |language= |df= }} </ref>
According to retired Canadian Major General [[Lewis MacKenzie]], interviewed on [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]] radio on 26 July, Hess-von Kruedener's phrase ‘due to tactical necessity’ was “veiled speech in the military. What he was telling us was Hezbollah fighters were all over his position and the IDF were targeting them.”<ref name = "MacK" /><ref>{{cite news|title=Metro Morning RealPlayer audio clip |author=CBC |date=2006-07-26 |publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]] |url=http://cbc.ca/metromorning/media/20060726LMCJUL26.ram |authorlink=Canadian Broadcasting Corporation |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061029181547/http://www.cbc.ca/metromorning/media/20060726LMCJUL26.ram |archivedate=2006-10-29 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Hezbollah was using UN post as 'shield' |author=Joel Kom |date=2006-07-27 |publisher=The Ottawa Citizen |url=http://www.canada.com/components/print.aspx?id=37278180-a261-421d-84a9-7f94d5fc6d50 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061010012455/http://www.canada.com/components/print.aspx?id=37278180-a261-421d-84a9-7f94d5fc6d50 |archivedate=2006-10-10 |df= }}</ref> However, Major Paeta Hess-von Kruedener's widow Cynthia stated on 29 July that she blamed the IDF for her husband’s death. She said “Why did they bomb the UN site? In my opinion, those are precision-guided missiles [so] then that it is intentional.…And that wasn’t the only day they were firing on that base. My information from him [her husband] is that week upon week they had been firing on there, bombing near it.”<ref name="Cynthia">{{cite web |url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060726/harper_soldier_death_060727?s_name=&no_ads= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060818162215/http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060726/harper_soldier_death_060727?s_name=&no_ads= |dead-url=yes |archive-date=August 18, 2006 |title=UN observer's wife calls Israel attack 'intentional' |accessdate=2007-01-21 |date=July 28, 2006 |publisher=[[CTV television network]] |df= }} </ref> It has not yet been determined if the munitions were guided or not.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}}
==Other incidents==
The [https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/unifilpress.htm UNIFIL press releases] mention dozen of attacks and near misses on its presence during the present conflict.
*UN personnel were pelted with stones by an angry Lebanese crowd after recovering bodies from the aftermath of an IAF airstrike on a convoy fleeing [[Marwaheen]] close to Tyre.<ref>http://observer.guardian.co.uk/world/story/0,,1821706,00.html Children die in convoy attack as Israel widens Lebanon assault, July 16, 2006</ref> *Shrapnel from tank shells fired by the IDF seriously wounded an Indian soldier on 16 July.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date=July 17, 2006 |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr01.pdf |format=PDF |title=Press Release |accessdate=2006-08-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060807051458/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr01.pdf |archivedate=7 August 2006 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> *A UNIFIL international staff member and his wife were killed after the Israeli air force bombed the Hosh district of [[Tyre, Lebanon|Tyre]], Lebanon, where they lived on, July 17.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher= [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date= July 19, 2006 |url= https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr03.pdf |format= PDF |title= Press Release |accessdate= 2006-08-07 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060807051456/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr03.pdf| archivedate= 7 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref> Their bodies were recovered from the rubble on July 26.<ref>{{cite press release |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date=July 26, 2006 |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr10.pdf |format=PDF |title=Press Release |accessdate=2006-08-07 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} </ref> *Hezbollah fire wounded an Italian OGL observer on the border on July 23.<ref name = "UNIFILPR8">{{cite press release |publisher= [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date= July 24, 2006 |url= https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr08.pdf |format= PDF |title= Press Release |accessdate= 2006-08-07 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060807051501/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr08.pdf| archivedate= 7 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref> *An IDF tank shell hit a UNIFIL position south of Rmaich on Monday 24 July, wounding four Ghanaian soldiers.<ref name="UNIFILPR9">{{cite press release |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date=July 25, 2006 |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr09.pdf |format=PDF |title=Press Release |accessdate=2006-08-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060807051521/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr09.pdf |archivedate=7 August 2006 |deadurl=yes |df= }} </ref> *On July 25, Hezbollah opened fire on a UNIFIL convoy, forcing it to retreat.<ref name = "UNIFILPR9" /> *On 29 July, two Indian UN soldiers were wounded after their post was damaged during an IAF airstrike in Southern Lebanon.<ref>2 Indian peacekeepers hurt in Israeli strike, Reuters [http://www.dnaindia.com/report.asp?NewsID=1044454] 29 July 2006</ref> *On 30 July, following an airstrike on a house in [[Qana]] where 28 civilians are confirmed killed with 13 missing, thousands of Lebanese protesters who had reportedly gathered spontaneously in the city centre attacked the UN building in Beirut along with UN staff.<ref>{{cite news |title=UN stormed amid fury over Qana bombing |author=Aljazeera.net |date=2006-07-30 |publisher=[[Aljazeera]] |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/6334D333-E2A2-4F66-81E6-42FD108FD8BB.htm |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060826164448/http://english.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/6334D333-E2A2-4F66-81E6-42FD108FD8BB.htm |archivedate=2006-08-26 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Anger over Qana bombing explodes in Beirut |author=Euronews.net |date=2006-07-30 |publisher=[[Euronews]] |url=http://euronews.net/create_html.php?page=detail_info&article=372609&lng=1 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930230608/http://euronews.net/create_html.php?page=detail_info&article=372609&lng=1 |archivedate=2007-09-30 |df= }}</ref> *On 6 August, a Hezbollah rocket hit the headquarters of the Chinese UNIFIL contingent, injuring three Chinese peacekeepers.<ref name = "UNIFILPR21">{{cite press release |publisher= [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] |date= August 6, 2006 |url= https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr021.pdf |format= PDF |title= Press Release |accessdate= 2006-08-07 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060812141258/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr021.pdf| archivedate= 12 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref>
*On 6 August, UNIFIL announced that “[s]ince the outbreak of hostilities, four military observers from OGL, one UNIFIL international staff member and his wife were killed, and four Ghanaian soldiers, three Indian soldiers, three Chinese soldiers and one OGL military observer were wounded as a result of firing.”<ref name = "UNIFILPR21" /> *On 12 August, UNIFIL announced that a Ghanaian peacekeeper had been wounded by IDF artillery fire near the southern village of [[Hariss]].<ref>{{cite press release |publisher=[[Reuters]] |date=August 12, 2006 |url=http://today.reuters.com/news/articlenews.aspx?type=topNews&storyID=2006-08-12T191330Z_01_L12144752_RTRUKOC_0_US-MIDEAST.xml&pageNumber=2&imageid=&cap=&sz=13&WTModLoc=NewsArt-C1-ArticlePage2 |title=Israel and Hizbollah fight on |accessdate=2006-08-12 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} </ref>
*On 14 August, the IDF targeted what it said was a Palestinian faction in the [[Ein el-Hilweh]] refugee camp in [[Sidon|Saida]]. Two missiles were fired into a civilian residential area and killed UNRWA staff member Mr. [[Abdel Saghir]].[http://www.thenews.com.pk/update_detail.asp?id=7780]<ref>{{cite press release |publisher= [[UNRWA Official Homepage]] |date= August 16, 2006 |url= https://www.un.org/unrwa/news/releases/pr-2006/leb_15aug06.pdf |format=PDF|title= UNRWA Strongly Condemns the Killing of its Staff Member |accessdate= 2006-08-16 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20060820094519/http://www.un.org/unrwa/news/releases/pr-2006/leb_15aug06.pdf| archivedate= 20 August 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} </ref> Meanwhile, the United Nations Security Council failed to agree on a statement responding to the Israeli attack after the United States refused to accept language condemning: "any deliberate attack against U.N. personnel."'<ref>[http://www.democracynow.org/article.pl?sid=06/07/27/1423230 Headlines for 27 July 2006 ] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060730133608/http://www.democracynow.org/article.pl?sid=06%2F07%2F27%2F1423230 |date=30 July 2006 }}</ref>
INTEGRATE taken from Targeting of civilian areas in the 2006 Israel-Lebanon conflict
The [[United Nations Interim Force In Lebanon]] (UNIFIL) was created by the [[United Nations]], to confirm [[Israel]]i withdrawal from [[Lebanon]], restore the international peace and security, and help the Lebanese Government restore its effective authority in the area. During the current (as in past conflicts; see [[Qana shelling]]) the peacekeeping force has come under attack from both sides{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}}, but mainly from Israeli forces.<ref>[https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/unifilpress.htm Press Release] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060725043129/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/unifilpress.htm |date=July 25, 2006 }}, [[UNIFIL]], 2006-08-09</ref> About 50 members of the unarmed UNTSO are being evacuated to lightly armed UNIFIL positions for security reasons.<ref>{{cite news|title=UN removes observers from border |date=2006-07-28 |publisher=[[The Jerusalem Post]] |url=http://fr.jpost.com/servlet/Satellite?cid=1153292021843&pagename=JPost/JPArticle/ShowFull }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
The worst of these came on 25 July 2006, when four unarmed [[UNTSO]] peacekeepers from Austria, China, Finland and Canada were killed in an Israeli air strike on a UN observation post in southern Lebanon. According to the UN, the four had taken shelter in a bunker under the post. It had been shelled 14 times by Israeli artillery over a period of 6 hours, during which the post called an Israeli liaison officer ten times to call off the bombardement. Every time he promised to do so.<ref>[http://www.spiegel.de/politik/ausland/0,1518,428698,00.html Vier Blauhelm-Soldaten sterben: Stunden der Todesangst im Uno-Posten Chijam - Politik - SPIEGEL ONLINE - Nachrichten<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Secretary General [[Kofi Annan]] said in a statement from Rome that he was " ... shocked and deeply distressed by the apparently deliberate targeting by Israeli Defense Forces."<ref name=BBC_Kofi>{{cite news|title=Israel troops 'ignored' UN plea|date=2006-07-26|publisher=[[BBC News]]|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/5217176.stm}}</ref> The site of the observation post was well known, and both sides in the conflict had the coordinates of the compound.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} However, as at the time Annan had no evidence for the bombing being deliberate, many pundits described Annan’s statement as indicative of the UN's anti-Israel bias.<ref name="nydailynews.com"/><ref name="jpost.com"/><ref name = "MacK"/><ref name="Known_better" /><ref name="http"/><ref name="MelKoifime"/> In press releases by UNIFIL on 26 July and 27 July it is noted that Hezbollah had been firing from close to 4 UNIFIL positions in Alma ash Shab, Tibnin Brashit and At Tiri.<ref>{{cite news|title=United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon: Press Release 26, July 2006 |author=UNIFIL |date=2006-07-26 |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr010.pdf |format=PDF |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060803093635/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr010.pdf |archivedate=2006-08-03 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon: Press Release 27, July 2006 |author=UNIFIL |date=2006-07-27 |publisher=[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] |url=https://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr011.pdf |format=PDF |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060812141328/http://www.un.org/Depts/dpko/missions/unifil/pr011.pdf |archivedate=2006-08-12 |df= }}</ref> Ireland's Foreign Ministry said a senior Irish soldier working for the UN forces was in contact with the Israelis six times to warn them that their bombardment was endangering the lives of U.N. staff and on several occasions they were reassured that it will.<ref>{{cite news|title=Israel promises full probe into UN deaths|date=2006-07-26|publisher=[[cbc.ca]]|url=http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2006/07/25/un-lebanon.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Olmert orders investigation into deadly IAF strike on UN base|date=2006-07-26|publisher=[[Haaretz.com]]|url=http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/743051.html}}</ref>
According to an interview on [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]] radio and multiple print sources, Retired Canadian Major General [[Lewis MacKenzie]], referring to an email he had received a few days previously from the now deceased Canadian peacekeeper Major Paeta Hess-von Kruedener, stated that "...what he was telling us was Hezbollah fighters were all over his position and the IDF were (sic) targeting them and that's a favorite trick by people who don't have representation in the UN. They use the UN as shields knowing that they can't be punished for it." <ref>[http://www.canada.com/components/print.aspx?id=37278180-a261-421d-84a9-7f94d5fc6d50 Hezbollah was using UN post as 'shield'] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061010012455/http://www.canada.com/components/print.aspx?id=37278180-a261-421d-84a9-7f94d5fc6d50 |date=2006-10-10 }}, ''[[Canada.com]]'', 2006-07-27</ref><ref>[http://www.nysun.com/pf.php?id=36860 Annan's Claims On Casualties May Unravel], ''[[New York Sun]]'', 2006-07-27</ref>
==Total casualties== {| border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" align="center" class="wikitable" ! style="background:#B0C4DE; color:black"| Country !!style="background:#B0C4DE; color:black"| Civilian !!style="background:#B0C4DE; color:blck"| Military |- |{{flagcountry|Austria}} | |1 dead |- |{{flagcountry|Canada}} | |1 dead |- |{{flagicon|China}} [[People’s Republic of China|China, People’s Republic of]] | |1 dead<br>3 wounded |- |{{flagcountry|Finland}} | |1 dead |- |{{flagcountry|Ghana}} | |5 wounded |- |{{flagcountry|India}} | |3 wounded |- |{{flagcountry|Italy}} | |1 wounded |- |{{flagcountry|Nigeria}} |1 dead | |- !align="left" style="background:#B0C4DE; color:black"| Total | style="background:#B0C4DE; color:black"|'''1 dead''' || style="background:#B0C4DE; color:black"|'''4 dead<br>12 wounded''' |}
==Israeli flyovers== In the aftermath of the war, aircraft of the [[Israeli Air Force]] began fly over Lebanon. In September 2006, Major General [[Alain Pellegrini]] of France, commander of UNIFIL, warned that the flyovers violated the cease-fire, and that force might be used to stop the incursions.<ref>http://www.haaretz.com/hasen/spages/785914.html</ref> In October 2006, a number of incidents between the Israeli Air Force and UN peacekeepers took place:
* On 3 October 2006, an Israeli fighter jet penetrated the {{convert|2|nmi|km|adj=on}} defence perimeter of the French frigate ''Courbet'', triggering a diplomatic incident between Israel and France. Israel apologized after official protests from France. * On 24 October 2006, six Israeli fighter jets flew over a German vessel patrolling off Israel's coast just south of Lebanon, after a helicopter took off from the vessel without Israeli permission. The German Defense Ministry claimed that the planes fired flares, and one fired two shots into the air. Israeli officials denied the claim of two shots being fired, but claimed they did not know whether flares had been used. * On 31 October 2006, eight Israeli [[F-15 Eagle|F-15]] fighter jets flew over many areas of Lebanon, including [[Beirut]]. The jets also nose-dived over a French peacekeeping position in what was interpreted as attack formation. French troops responded by readying an anti-aircraft missile. According to French Defence Minister [[Michele Alliot-Marie]], the troops were "seconds away" from firing the missile at the jets.

page.title: Intersex rights in the United States

revision.text:
{{Infobox intersex rights | location_header = the [[United States]] {{flagicon|United States}} | image = USA orthographic.svg | caption = [[United States]] | prohibit_harmful = No | reparations = No | discrimination_protections = In healthcare | equality_men_women = No | mf_identification = Varies | third_identification = Varies | marriage = Yes }} {{Intersex sidebar}} [[Intersex]] people in the [[United States]] have some of the same rights as other people, but with significant gaps, particularly in protection from non-consensual cosmetic medical interventions and violence, and protection from discrimination. Actions by intersex civil society organizations aim to eliminate harmful practices, promote social acceptance, and equality. In recent years, intersex activists have also secured some forms of legal recognition.
==History== {{further|Intersex in history}} Early accounts of intersex people in North America include those of English immigrant [[Thomas(ine) Hall]], in 17th-century [[Colony of Virginia|colonial Virginia]] and 19th-century [[Connecticut]] intersex man [[Levi Suydam]], pronounced male and so eligible to vote. Early [[common law]], like [[canon law]],<ref name="Raming">{{cite book | title = A History of Women and Ordination | last1 = Raming | first1 = Ida | last2 = Macy | first2 = Gary | last3 = Bernard J | first3 = Cook | publisher = [[Scarecrow Press]] | date = 2004 | page = 113}}</ref> held that hermaphrodites were to be treated as male or female depending on the prevailing sex.<ref>{{Cite journal| volume = 41| last = Greenberg| first = Julie| title = Defining Male and Female: Intersexuality and the Collision Between Law and Biology| journal = Arizona Law Review| date = 1999| ssrn = 896307|pages = 277–278}}</ref><ref>[[Edward Coke|E Coke]], The First Part of the Institutes of the Laws of England, Institutes 8.a. (1st Am. Ed. 1812).</ref>
In September 2017, an intersex and [[Nonbinary|non-binary]] student, [[Scout Schultz]] was shot dead at the [[Georgia Institute of Technology]]. In November 2017, Betsy Driver became the first intersex person openly elected to public office in the United States. Driver was elected as a council person in the New Jersey city of Flemington. Driver is the second publicly intersex person elected to office, following [[Tony Briffa]] in Australia.<ref>{{Cite news| last = Lang| first = Nico| title = Betsy Driver Is Ready for America's Intersex Tipping Point| work = INTO| accessdate = 2018-09-05| date = December 7, 2017| url = https://intomore.com/impact/Betsy-Driver-Is-Ready-for-Americas-Intersex-Tipping-Point/f061b1e09eed44f4}}</ref>
===Intersex medical interventions=== Since the mid-twentieth century, U.S. physicians have considered intersex status in infants a "psychosocial emergency" and performed "normalizing" or "reconstructive" genital surgery without considering non-surgical alternatives (e.g., counseling).<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|last=Chase|first=Cheryl|date=2002|title='Cultural Practice' or 'Reconstructive Surgery'? U.S. Genital Cutting, the Intersex Movement, and Medical Double Standards|url=|journal=Genital Cutting and Transnational Sisterhood|volume=126|pages=|via=}}</ref> When deciding whether to assign the intersex infant "male" or "female," the factors typically considered are potential for [[fertility]] and [[sexual penetration]].<ref name=":0" /> These surgeries still continue in the U.S. today despite being medically unnecessary (that is, chiefly cosmetic) and potentially injurious to the patient's sexual pleasure.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hrw.org/report/2017/07/25/i-want-be-nature-made-me/medically-unnecessary-surgeries-intersex-children-us|title="I Want to Be Like Nature Made Me" {{!}} Medically Unnecessary Surgeries on Intersex Children in the US|date=2017-07-25|work=Human Rights Watch|access-date=2018-04-24|language=en}}</ref>
===The intersex movement=== The U.S. intersex movement developed in the 1990s and 2000s, through the establishment of the [[Intersex Society of North America]] (ISNA) and the [[Androgen insensitivity syndrome|AIS]] Support Group USA (now called AISDSD)<ref>{{cite web | url = http://aisdsd.org/who-we-are/history/brief-history/ | title = A Brief History | work = AISDSD | accessdate = 2017-01-15 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20150427122155/http://aisdsd.org/who-we-are/history/brief-history/ | archivedate = 2015-04-27 | df = }}</ref> in the 1990s, and Advocates for Informed Choice (now [[Interact Advocates for Intersex Youth|interACT]]), Bodies Like Ours,<ref name="karkazis2008">{{Cite book| publisher = Duke University Press| isbn = 978-0-8223-4318-9| last = Karkazis| first = Katrina| title = [[Fixing Sex|Fixing Sex: Intersex, Medical Authority, and Lived Experience]]| date = 2008 | page = 260}}</ref> Intersex Initiative,<ref name="karkazis2008" /> and [[Organisation Intersex International]],<ref name="karkazis2008" /> (now the [[Intersex Campaign for Equality]]) in the following decade.
The [[Intersex Society of North America]] (ISNA) was a non-profit advocacy group founded in 1993 by [[Cheryl Chase (activist)|Cheryl Chase]] to end shame, secrecy, and unwanted genital surgeries.<ref>[http://www.aissg.org/articles/HOLMES.HTM Re-membering a Queer Body] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511182712/http://www.aissg.org/articles/HOLMES.HTM |date=2013-05-11 }}, AISSG, syndicated copy of article from Undercurrents (May 1994: 11-13) by the Faculty of Environmental Studies, York University, Ontario.</ref><ref>[http://pi.library.yorku.ca/ojs/index.php/currents/article/view/37695/34194 Re-membering a Queer Body] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131230235845/http://pi.library.yorku.ca/ojs/index.php/currents/article/view/37695/34194 |date=2013-12-30 }}, UnderCurrents (May 1994: 11-13), Faculty of Environmental Studies, York University, Ontario.</ref><ref name="matthews2000">Matthews, Karen (Oct 22, 2000). Debate Grows Over Using Surgery on Infants with Ambiguous Genitals. ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''</ref><ref name="murrell1998:">Murrell, Nancy (October 28, 1998). Intersex group raises questions about genital surgery. ''[[Miami Herald]]''</ref><ref name="hackford-peer2005">Hackford-Peer, Kim (2005). Cheryl Chase Founds the Intersex Society of North America. in ''GLBT History, 1993-2004''; 2005, p28-30, 2p</ref> Amongst other activities, it published the journal ''[[Hermaphrodites with Attitude]]''.
Intersex activism between the late 1990s and mid 2000s led from demonstrating outside a national pediatric conference, to speaking inside clinical conferences, and the first human rights investigation into medical "normalization", by the Human Rights Commission of the City and County of San Francisco.<ref>{{Cite book| last1 = Human Rights Commission of the City and County of San Francisco| last2 = de María Arana| first2 = Marcus| title = A Human Rights Investigation Into The Medical "Normalization" Of Intersex People| location = San Francisco| date = 2005| url = http://www.aph.gov.au/DocumentStore.ashx?id=2bbf04f0-66c8-4dd9-9c20-2cdb1c936f79| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20131228070803/http://www.aph.gov.au/DocumentStore.ashx?id=2bbf04f0-66c8-4dd9-9c20-2cdb1c936f79| archivedate = 2013-12-28| df = }}</ref> However, coercive [[intersex medical interventions]] persist.<ref name="interact2016un" />
ISNA closed in June 2008 after supporting the creation of a new clinical term for intersex conditions, [[Disorders of Sex Development]] (DSD), albeit ambivalently as a means of opening "many more doors" and engaging with clinicians,<ref name="ISNADSD">{{cite web | work = [[Intersex Society of North America]] | date = 24 May 2006 | url = http://www.isna.org/node/1066 | title = Why is ISNA using "DSD"? | accessdate = 4 June 2006 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20060617190952/http://www.isna.org/node/1066 | archivedate = 17 June 2006 | df = }}</ref> and also supporting the establishment of a new organization, the [[Accord Alliance]], set up to promote comprehensive and integrated approaches to healthcare.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.accordalliance.org/ | title = Welcome to Accord Alliance | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100721234219/http://www.accordalliance.org/ | archivedate = 2010-07-21 | df = }}</ref> New organizations such as [[Intersex Campaign for Equality]] and [[Interact Advocates for Intersex Youth|interACT]] were since established with civil and human rights goals.
interACT has worked with MTV on the program ''[[Faking It (2014 TV series)|Faking It]]'', notable for providing the first intersex main character in a television show,<ref>{{Cite web |title= Meet television's groundbreaking intersex character |url= https://www.buzzfeed.com/louispeitzman/meet-televisions-groundbreaking-intersex-character |website= Buzzfeed |deadurl= no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160529020917/https://www.buzzfeed.com/louispeitzman/meet-televisions-groundbreaking-intersex-character |archivedate= 2016-05-29 |df= }}</ref> and television's first intersex character played by an intersex actor.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newnownext.com/faking-it-intersex/04/2016/|title="Faking It" Breaks New Ground With First Intersex Actor To Play Intersex Character On TV|website=New Now Next|access-date=5 April 2016|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160405070107/http://www.newnownext.com/faking-it-intersex/04/2016/|archivedate=5 April 2016|df=}}</ref> In 2017, interACT worked with model [[Hanne Gaby Odiele]] to tackle social taboos.<ref name="miller2017">{{cite web | url = https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/01/23/model-hanne-gaby-odiele-reveals-she-intersex/96622908/ | title = Model Hanne Gaby Odiele reveals she is intersex | last = Miller | first = Susan | work = [[USA Today]] | date = January 23, 2017 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170123193337/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2017/01/23/model-hanne-gaby-odiele-reveals-she-intersex/96622908/ | archivedate = January 23, 2017 | df = }}</ref><ref name="interAct2017han">{{cite web | url = http://interactadvocates.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/PRESSRELEASE-HannesAnnouncement.pdf | title = International Fashion Model Hanne Gaby Odiele Reveals She is Intersex; Announces Partnership with interACT Advocates for Intersex Youth to Raise Awareness About the Importance of Human Rights Protections for Intersex People Worldwide | work = [[Interact Advocates for Intersex Youth|interACT]] | date = January 23, 2017 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170129114102/http://interactadvocates.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/PRESSRELEASE-HannesAnnouncement.pdf | archivedate = January 29, 2017 | df = }}</ref>
== Physical integrity and bodily autonomy == [[File:Protection of intersex children from harmful practices.svg|thumb|right|260px| {{legend|#002255|Legal prohibition of non-consensual [[Intersex medical interventions|medical interventions]]}} {{legend|#0066FF|Regulatory suspension of non-consensual medical interventions}}]]{{further|Intersex human rights|Intersex medical interventions|History of intersex surgery}}
=== Demonstration and American Academy of Pediatrics statement === In October 1996, the [[American Academy of Pediatrics]] issued a press statement stating that:
{{quote| * The Academy is deeply concerned about the emotional, cognitive, and body image development of intersexuals, and believes that successful early genital surgery minimizes these issues. * Research on children with ambiguous genitalia has shown that a person's sexual body image is largely a function of socialization, and children whose genetic sexes are not clearly reflected in external genitalia can be raised successfully as members of either sexes if the process begins before 2 1/2 years. * Management and understanding of intersex conditions has significantly improved, particularly over the last several decades ...<ref name="aap1996">{{Cite web| last = American Academy of Pediatrics| author-link = American Academy of Pediatrics| title = American Academy of Pediatrics Position on Intersexuality| work = [[Intersex Day]]| accessdate = 2017-07-03| date = October 1996| url = http://intersexday.org/en/aap-position-1996/| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160119031644/http://intersexday.org/en/aap-position-1996/| archivedate = 2016-01-19| df = }}</ref>}}
The statement was issued in response to the first public demonstration by intersex people and allies, outside the annual conference of the Academy, in Boston on October 26, 1996. [[Morgan Holmes]] has written that the demonstration happened after activists [[Max Beck]] and Holmes were excluded from the conference. She states that the pair went to deliver an address, "on long-term outcomes and to challenging their still-prevailing opinion that cosmetic surgery to "fix" intersexed genitals was the best course of action", but were "met, officially, with hostility and were escorted out of the conference by security guards".<ref name="holmes2006">{{Cite book| publisher = University of Minnesota Press| pages = 32–50| last = Holmes| first = Morgan| authorlink = Morgan Holmes |title = Transgender Rights| chapter = Deciding fate or protecting a developing autonomy? Intersex children and the Colombian Constitutional Court| location = Minneapolis, Minnesota| date = 2006}}</ref> The demonstration, by Beck and Holmes, with allies from Transexual Menace, is now marked as [[Intersex Awareness Day]].<ref name="beck">{{Cite web| last = Beck| first = Max| author-link = Max Beck| title = Hermaphrodites with Attitude Take to the Streets| journal = [[Hermaphrodites with Attitude]]| publisher = [[Intersex Society of North America]]| url = http://www.isna.org/books/chrysalis/beck| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151005043221/http://www.isna.org/books/chrysalis/beck| archivedate = 2015-10-05| df = }}</ref><ref name="holmes2015">{{Citation| work = [[Intersex Day]]| last = Holmes| first = Morgan| authorlink = Morgan Holmes| title = When Max Beck and Morgan Holmes went to Boston| date = October 2015| url = http://intersexday.org/en/max-beck-morgan-holmes-boston-1996/| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20151020004238/http://intersexday.org/en/max-beck-morgan-holmes-boston-1996/| archivedate = 2015-10-20| df = }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://intersexday.org/en/origin-intersex-awareness-day/ |title=The origins of Intersex Awareness Day |last1=Driver |first1=Betsy |date=14 October 2015 |work=[[Intersex Day]] |publisher= |access-date=2015-10-24 |quote= |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151020004155/http://intersexday.org/en/origin-intersex-awareness-day/ |archivedate=20 October 2015 |df= }}</ref>
=== San Francisco Human Rights Commission report, 2005=== A 2005 human rights investigation into the medical "normalization" of Intersex People, by the [[San Francisco Human Rights Commission]] is thought "likely to be the first human rights report into the treatment of intersex people, certainly in the English language."<ref>{{cite web | url = http://oii.org.au/22613/third-submission-senate-inquiry-sterilisation/ | title = Third submission to Senate Inquiry on involuntary sterilisation | work = [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] | date = 6 June 2013 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20131228101621/http://oii.org.au/22613/third-submission-senate-inquiry-sterilisation/ | archivedate = 28 December 2013 | df = }}</ref><ref name="sanfran">{{cite web | url = http://sf-hrc.org/sites/default/files/Documents/HRC_Publications/Articles/A_Human_Rights_Investigation_Into_the_Normalization_of_Intersex_People.pdf | title = Human Rights Investigation into the Medical "Normalization" of Intersex People | last = Human Rights Commission of the City and County of San Francisco | author-link = San Francisco Human Rights Commission | date = 2005 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180104124444/http://sf-hrc.org/sites/default/files/Documents/HRC_Publications/Articles/A_Human_Rights_Investigation_Into_the_Normalization_of_Intersex_People.pdf | archivedate = 2018-01-04 | df = }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://oii.org.au/23387/august-submission-senate-inquiry-sterilisation/ | title = Concluding submission to the Senate Inquiry on involuntary or coerced sterilisation | work = [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] | date = 12 September 2013 | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20131228175046/http://oii.org.au/23387/august-submission-senate-inquiry-sterilisation/ | archivedate = 28 December 2013 | df = }}</ref>
{{quote| #Infant genital surgeries and sex hormone treatments that are not performed for the treatment of physical illness, such as improving urinary tract or metabolic functioning, and have not been shown to alleviate pain or illness (hereafter referred to as "normalizing" interventions) are unnecessary and are not medical or social emergencies. #"Normalizing" interventions done without the patient's informed consent are inherent human rights abuses. #"Normalizing" interventions deprive intersex people of the opportunity to express their own identity and to experience their own intact physiology. #It is unethical to disregard a child's intrinsic human rights to privacy, dignity, autonomy, and physical integrity by altering genitals through irreversible surgeries for purely psychosocial and aesthetic rationales. It is wrong to deprive a person of the right to determine their sexual experience and identity. ... #It is ethically wrong to treat people differently or unfairly because they are perceived by others to be "monsters" or "oddities."|Human Rights Commission of the City and County of San Francisco<ref name="sanfran" />}}
===Clinical shift to Disorders of Sex Development=== In 2005, [[Cheryl Chase (activist)|Cheryl Chase]], [[Alice Dreger]] and others called for the replacement of the word "[[hermaphrodite]]" with "[[Disorders of Sex Development]]" (DSD).<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Dreger|first=Alice D.|last2=Chase|first2=Cheryl|last3=Sousa|first3=Aron|last4=Gruppuso|first4=Phillip A.|last5=Frader|first5=Joel|date=18 August 2005|title="Changing the Nomenclature/Taxonomy for Intersex: A Scientific and Clinical Rationale."|url=http://www.aissg.org/PDFs/Dreger-Nomenclature-2005.PDF|journal=Journal of Pediatric Endocrinology and Metabolism|volume=|issue=|doi=|pmid=|access-date=27 July 2016|via=|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220154642/http://www.aissg.org/PDFs/Dreger-Nomenclature-2005.PDF|archivedate=20 December 2016|df=}}</ref> Later the same year, a clinical "Intersex Consensus Meeting" of US and European pediatric endocrine societies adopted "DSD" as a replacement for both intersex and hermaphrodite in medical settings.<ref name="davis2015">{{Cite book| work = [[NYU Press]]| isbn = 978-1-4798-3786-1| last = Davis| first = Georgiann| authorlink = Georgiann Davis| title = Contesting Intersex, The Dubious Diagnosis| location = New York| date = 2015| url = http://nyupress.org/books/9781479887040/| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160929052310/http://nyupress.org/books/9781479887040/| archivedate = 2016-09-29| df = }}</ref>
The new language of Disorders of Sex Development was always contentious as was seen as pathologizing. Scholars and activists, such as [[Georgiann Davis]],<ref name="davis-dsd">{{cite web|url=http://www.emeraldinsight.com/books.htm?chapterid=1943090 |first=Georgiann |last=Davis|authorlink=Georgiann Davis| date =2011|title =DSD is a Perfectly Fine Term": Reasserting Medical Authority through a Shift in Intersex Terminology|editor1-first= PJ |editor1-last=McGann|editor2-first=David J. |editor2-last=Hutson|journal=Sociology of Diagnosis (Advances in Medical Sociology)|volume =12|publisher=Emerald Group Publishing Limited|pages=155–182}}</ref> and [[Morgan Holmes]],<ref name="morgan-name">{{cite journal | year = 2011| title = The Intersex Enchiridion: Naming and Knowledge in the Clinic | url = http://www.euppublishing.com/doi/abs/10.3366/soma.2011.0026?journalCode=soma | journal = Somatechnics | volume = 1 | issue = 2| pages = 87–114 | doi = 10.3366/soma.2011.0026 | last1 = Holmes| first1 = Morgan|authorlink = Morgan Holmes}}</ref> [[Esther Morris Leidolf]],<ref>{{cite book | first = Georgiann | last = Davis | author-link = Georgiann Davis | title = Contesting Intersex: The Dubious Diagnosis | publisher = NYU Press | date = September 2015 | ISBN = 9781479887040 | page = 45}}</ref> and clinical psychologists like [[Tiger Devore]]<ref name="tiger">{{cite web|url=http://wewhofeeldifferently.info/interview.php?interview=108|title=An Interview with Dr. Tiger Howard Devore PhD|work=We Who Feel Differently|date=February 7, 2011|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304001202/http://wewhofeeldifferently.info/interview.php?interview=108|archivedate=March 4, 2016|df=}}</ref> regarded this shift as a retrenchment of medical authority over intersex bodies.<ref name="OII_Position">{{Citation | last = Briffa | first = Tony | author-link = Tony Briffa | title = Tony Briffa writes on "Disorders of Sex Development" | date = 8 May 2014 | url = http://oii.org.au/26808/tony-briffa-on-dsd/ | publisher = [[Organisation Intersex International Australia]] | deadurl = no | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141230120725/http://oii.org.au/26808/tony-briffa-on-dsd/ | archivedate = 30 December 2014 | df = }}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal| volume = 38| issue = 5| pages = 33–36| last1 = Feder| first1 = Ellen K.| last2 = Karkazis| first2 = Katrina| author2-link = Katrina Karkazis | title = What's in a Name? The Controversy over "Disorders of Sex Development"| journal = [[Hastings Center Report]]| date = 2008}}</ref> In May 2016, interACT published a statement opposing pathologizing language to describe people born with intersex traits, recognizing "increasing general understanding and acceptance of the term "intersex"".<ref name="interact2016">{{Cite web| last = interACT| title = interACT Statement on Intersex Terminology| work = [[Interact Advocates for Intersex Youth]]| accessdate = 30 May 2016| date = May 2016| url = http://interactadvocates.org/interact-statement-on-intersex-terminology/| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160608195140/http://interactadvocates.org/interact-statement-on-intersex-terminology/| archivedate = 8 June 2016| df = }}</ref>
Research by the [[Lurie Children's Hospital]], Chicago, and the AISDSD Support Group published in 2017 found that 80% of affected Support Group respondents "strongly liked, liked or felt neutral about intersex" as a term, while caregivers were less supportive.<ref name="johnson2017">{{Cite journal| doi = 10.1016/j.jpurol.2017.03.035| issn = 1477-5131| last1 = Johnson| first1 = Emilie K.| last2 = Rosoklija| first2 = Ilina| last3 = Finlayso| first3 = Courtney| last4 = Chen| first4 = Diane| last5 = Yerkes| first5 = Elizabeth B.| last6 = Madonna| first6 = Mary Beth| last7 = Holl| first7 = Jane L.| last8 = Baratz| first8 = Arlene B.| last9 = Davis| first9 = Georgiann| last10 = Cheng| first10 = Earl Y.| author9-link = Georgiann Davis| title = Attitudes towards "disorders of sex development" nomenclature among affected individuals| journal = Journal of Pediatric Urology| date = May 2017| url = http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1477513117301833| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180104123949/http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S1477513117301833| archivedate = 2018-01-04| df = }}</ref> The hospital found that "disorders of sex development" terminology may negatively affect care, give offence, and result in lower attendance at medical clinics.<ref name="lurie2017">{{Cite news| last = Newswise| title = Term "Disorders of Sex Development" May Have Negative Impact| work = Newswise| accessdate = 2017-05-11| date = 2017-05-11| url = http://www.newswise.com/articles/term-disorders-of-sex-development-may-have-negative-impact| deadurl = no| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170515104842/http://www.newswise.com/articles/term-disorders-of-sex-development-may-have-negative-impact| archivedate = 2017-05-15| df = }}</ref> The research results for "disorders of sex development" mirrored earlier results from a survey of a [[congenital adrenal hyperplasia]] support group, the CARES Foundation.<ref name="johnson2017" />
